title: Law's Past Affiliation with Doflamingo
theory: Based on Doflamingo and Vergo repeatedly calling Law a 'brat' and Doflamingo's extreme reaction to Law's betrayal, fans theorized that Law was affiliated with Doflamingo when he was a child and resented it all these years, making this infiltration overdue payback.
author: Various One Piece fans (2013)
notes: This theory was widely discussed in 2013 when the episode aired and was later confirmed during the Dressrosa Arc when Law's backstory was revealed.

title: Doflamingo's Control Over the Underworld
theory: Episode 608 led fans to theorize that Doflamingo's influence extends far beyond what was shown, with connections throughout the Marine organization (proven by Vergo) and the underworld. Fans speculated he might be one of the most powerful individuals in the One Piece world despite not being an Emperor.
author: One Piece community (2013)
notes: The extent of Doflamingo's influence was fully revealed during the Dressrosa Arc, confirming he was indeed one of the most connected individuals in the world.

title: SAD and SMILE Connection to Kaido
theory: After seeing Law infiltrate the SAD production room and Doflamingo's extreme reaction, fans theorized that the SAD production must be connected to one of the Four Emperors, likely Kaido, making this operation critical to the New World power balance.
author: One Piece theorists (2013)
notes: This theory was confirmed shortly after when Law explained his plan to take down Kaido by disrupting the SMILE production.

title: The Donquixote Family Structure
theory: The simultaneous debut of multiple Donquixote Pirates officers led fans to theorize that Doflamingo's crew operates more like a mafia family than a traditional pirate crew, with specialized roles and a strict hierarchy. Some theorized there might be a 'suit' system (like playing cards) organizing the officers.
author: One Piece fans (2013)
notes: The crew structure was later revealed to have officer positions with different roles, though not exactly a 'suit' system. The family operates with a more complex hierarchy than typical pirate crews.
